metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3092 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The MultipartStream class in Apache Commons Fileupload before 1.3.2, asused in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.70, 8.x before 8.0.36, 8.5.x before8.5.3, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M7 and other products, allows remote attackersto cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a long boundary string.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libcommons-fileupload-java - 1.3.1-2ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1ubuntu0.1').
tomcat6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
libcommons-fileupload-java package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.1-2ubuntu0.1').
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.1').
